TopicTitle: Game bugging out after I return from EVA doing science.

Articles.Content:
I keep running into this strange bug where after I get back into the ship after I do and collect science, the game glitches out. Maybe this imgur album will explain better than I could in frustrated words because this is frustrating me to no end.

I've also had instances where I simply can't right click on anything when it bugs out, while everything else works.

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/4eto0)

Modlist:

Before anybody says narrow it down, I've TRIED, MULTIPLE TIMES. While the error does appear in stock, attempts to narrow it down have led to maybe module manager, DMagic Orbital Science (I suspect that this is actually a major culprit), several dead ends when I attempt to binary search since the error seems to reproduce sometimes and then suddenly not reproduce, even when I try to replicate conditions in a branchoff with few mods. In short, I have tried to narrow it down, but it goes in a different direction every time I try.

Sometimes it reproduces and sometimes it doesn't, I've even tried near-stock craft, but the only times it seems to 100% reproduce is in the exact game environment that I'm experiencing it in.

> 
> ![6tKMm2i.png](http://i.imgur.com/6tKMm2i.png)
> 
> 

Output log: [http://sta.sh/01ycb80ehvdn](http://sta.sh/01ycb80ehvdn)

Edit: Sometimes it triggers on EVA where I can't right click things and often it seems to happen after I toggle back from map view. To fix it, I have to go back to KSC and then return to the craft.

\*bump\*

\*bump\*

Hello? Anybody?

100 views and nobody? I keep having this problem every time I go on EVA and do science, most every time, and it's annoying as heck.

I already did, DMagic hasn't said anything about it.

\*KAPOWS IT TO THE FRONT\*

Should I assume that I'm the only one seeing this?

It's still happening as of 1.0.4, can ANYBODY even help or what? This is seriously frustrating!

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-05T19:30:19Z" title="07/05/2015 07:30  PM" data-short="9 yr">July 5, 2015</time> by sal\_vager**
Not really much we can say, I think. Try removing DMagic if you haven't, and check in the mod thread for any info. In fact, you might want to post this there.

Merged posts, sometimes people just don't know, like in this instance.

All I can really suggest is that you try another save, see if this issue is save specific, and keep your alt+f2 debug log open, watching for any errors as they occur.

> 
> Merged posts, sometimes people just don't know, like in this instance.
> All I can really suggest is that you try another save, see if this issue is save specific, and keep your alt+f2 debug log open, watching for any errors as they occur.

I'm trying to reproduce it again in a near stock branchoff. Also, I've had it over various saves, so it's not save specific.

Also, is there a way to resize the alt+F12 debug window? It's pretty darn big for me.

Edit: Though I'm trying to get things set up first....

As for errors (I'm using exceptiondetector along with alt+F12):

I'm using a near stock branchoff with just KJR, KER, GCmonitor, exception detector, stockbugfixmodules, and MM.

Triggered when I go back inside command pod after gathering science.

    InvalidOperationException: Collection was modified; enumeration operation may not execute.  at System.Collections.Generic.List`1+Enumerator[UnityEngine.Collider].VerifyState () [0x00000] in :0   at System.Collections.Generic.List`1+Enumerator[UnityEngine.Collider].MoveNext () [0x00000] in :0   at Part.OnDestroy () [0x00000] in :0 (Filename:  Line: -1)

Again later on

    InvalidOperationException: Collection was modified; enumeration operation may not execute.  at System.Collections.Generic.List`1+Enumerator[UnityEngine.Collider].VerifyState () [0x00000] in :0   at System.Collections.Generic.List`1+Enumerator[UnityEngine.Collider].MoveNext () [0x00000] in :0   at Part.OnDestroy () [0x00000] in :0 

Does anybody know anything about these exceptions?

    InvalidOperationException: Collection was modified; enumeration operation may not execute.  at System.Collections.Generic.List`1+Enumerator[UnityEngine.Collider].VerifyState () [0x00000] in :0   at System.Collections.Generic.List`1+Enumerator[UnityEngine.Collider].MoveNext () [0x00000] in :0   at Part.OnDestroy () [0x00000] in :0 

And again

    InvalidOperationException: Collection was modified; enumeration operation may not execute.  at System.Collections.Generic.List`1+Enumerator[UnityEngine.Collider].VerifyState () [0x00000] in :0   at System.Collections.Generic.List`1+Enumerator[UnityEngine.Collider].MoveNext () [0x00000] in :0   at Part.OnDestroy () [0x00000] in :0 

However, I can't seem to reproduce the problem, going to try it with MechJeb on.
